cache

cache.d -- easily allows for creating a cache of function call results

The cache is meant for non-trivial functions which might be called often with the same arguments. Upon creating a cache from a function, when one interfaces with the cache, the function will not be called if the same arguments are given. This means that pure functions are strongly reccomended.

Example:
 import cache;
 import std.stdio;

 void main() {
     // makes an empty cache
     Cache!(typeof(&factorial)) cache = createCache(&factorial);
     writeln(cache(3)); // calculates it
     writeln(cache(3)); // looks up in cache
 }

 ulong factorial(ulong n) {
     ulong r;
     for(r=1; n > 0; n--) {
         r *= n;
     }
     return r;
 }

template Cache(F) if (isCallable!(F))
The Cache class

Params:
F the type of the function

Cache!(F) createCache(F)(F func);
Creates a new cache from the function
